STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 30, 2021
Linda Needham
Lenawee County DHHS
1040 S. Winter Street
Adrian, MI 49221
RE: License #: CP460201242
Lenawee County DHHS
1040 S. Winter Street
Adrian, MI 49221
Dear Ms. Needham:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
9/29/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be
noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the MISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved. For repeat violations
please identify why the prior CAP was not effective and what changes will
be made to ensure ongoing compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Services

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of three foster home files held a renewal that was not submitted in the required
timeframe. The license expiration date was 12/30/20 and the report was submitted
on 12/17/20.
R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and parenting
time that contains, at a minimum, all of the following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster child
and the foster parent in the foster parent’s home at least once
every month.
(c) Provisions for visits between parents and children except
where parental rights have been terminated or when there is a
court determination that visits are detrimental to the child.
(b) One of six foster care files did not have a monthly home visit completed for
March 2021.
(c) One of six foster care files did not document parenting time for July 2021.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
11/18/20 INTERIM, CAP Approved 12/28/21
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(a) All of the following personal information pertaining to the
youth: (xii) A photograph updated on an annual basis.
4

One of one independent living files did not have photo updated annually. The photo
was last updated on 7/13/20.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
Following the FTM, the caseworker is responsible for the
following:
 Completing the DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report,
checking it for accuracy, identifying areas needing follow-
up, and recording the outcome data.
 Providing the DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report,
to all participants (in person and by phone), legal parents,
and casework supervisor. These documents must also
be uploaded into MISACWIS.
One of six foster care files did not meet this requirement. An 1105 report was not
completed for a 9/2/21 FTM.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
9/24/19 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 10/11/19
11/18/20 INTERIM, CAP Approved 12/28/21
FOM 801-03 Medical Passports
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Participating legal parents, if the child is a temporary court
ward. Quarterly, while in out-of-home placement. At
reunification.
• The child’s foster care provider: At or prior to each placement.
Quarterly.
5

Three of six foster care files did not meet this requirement.
File one: Quarterly updated medical passports were not completed between August
2020 and January 2021.
File two: A medical passport was updated on 1/17/21, the next update was not
quarterly (5/17/21).
File three: A medical passport was updated on 1/20/21, the next update was not
quarterly (6/21/21).
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
9/24/19 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 10/11/19
11/18/20 INTERIM, CAP Approved 12/28/21
FOM 722-06H Case Contacts
The caseworker must enter the required face-to-face contacts
listed below in MISACWIS within five business days of the
contact. This includes attempted and missed face-to-face
contacts.
Three of six foster care files had case contacts that were not entered into
MiSACWIS in the required timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
9/24/19 RENEWAL, CAP Approved 10/11/19
11/18/20 INTERIM, CAP Approved 12/28/21
FOM 722-08C Foster care parent agency treatment plan and service
agreement
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate, including
those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care worker, supervisor,
foster parent, caregiver, any youth age 14 and older and in the
case of placement agency foster care cases, the local DHS
office designee.
CI 17-099
All treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or later
must have signatures from all appropriate case members within
30 days of the report date.
6

Four of six foster care cases did not meet this requirement.
File one: 12/1/20 PATP did not have the parent signature and the foster parent did
not sign within 30 days. 3/1/21 PATP did not have the parent or foster parent
signatures. 5/28/21 and 8/26/21 PATPs were missing one parent signature.
File two: 6/15/21 PATP did not have the foster parent’s signature.
File three: 5/6/21 PATP had a late caregiver signature on 6/28/21.
File four: 1/2/21 PATP did not have the parent’s signatures.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Parent Agency Treatment Plan Signatures: One service plan had
documented in case contacts that a parent’s whereabouts were unknown.
The agency was advised to also document this information on the PATP
signature line.
 Medication documentation: One child’s medical passport noted the youth was
prescribed four psychotropic medications. However, this information was not
entered into the medical tab in MiSACWIS. The agency reported they are
unable to edit this tab as the MDHHS Psychotropic Medication Oversight Unit
(PMOU) is responsible for this information. The agency was advised to
contact the PMOU to have this information updated and document attempts
to have it corrected, as this tab also ties into Informed Consent timeliness and
reporting.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse or neglect during this
licensing period.
A special evaluation was completed by Monroe County DHHS for the Lenawee
DHHS foster home. The allegation was that the foster parent left a child in the car,
after work, into the evening hours. Law Enforcement and DHHS were involved in the
investigation. Upon completion of interviews, it was determined the allegation was
true and happened on more than one occasion. Revocation was recommended and
is currently pending with the disciplinary action unit of DCWL.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The CAP (approved 12/28/2020) was submitted as a result of the interim review
dated 11/18/2020. During the 2020 review the agency was cited in thirteen areas.
During this renewal evaluation only seven violations were found. The agency
7

reported implementing their CAP successfully, as is evident by the significant
improvement in several areas. While there were a few repeat violations, the instance
of each occurrence has decreased, which indicates their previous CAP has been
effective.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator reported that implementation of the CAP went well as they
have not had much turnover with staff this year. Staff have been retrained in some
areas, processes adjusted, and supervisory follow-up has increased where needed.
Overall, the Chief Administrator reported that she believed the agency showed
improvement from the findings of last year’s review.
Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported facing challenges during this
past year due to the pandemic and some difficulties with the court system. However,
both staff reported feeling supported by the agency and administration and feeling
that their needs are recognized and met. Neither staff had any concerns or
recommendations for areas in which the agency could improve.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued
a renewal of their regular license.
September 29, 2021
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 30, 2021
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
